alert.note: Alert for De Baca; Guadalupe; Quay; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 9:27PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New Mexico, including the following counties, De Baca, Guadalupe, Quay and Roosevelt. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 927 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Sumner, Sumner Lake, Sumner Lake State Park, Yeso and Taiban. - This includes the following recreation areas... Sumner Lake State Park and Fort Sumner State Monument. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 295 and 345. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
